alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 4:26PM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Columbia, northwestern Multnomah and southwestern Clark Counties through 500 PM PDT... At 425 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lake Shore, or near Vancouver Downtown, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Vancouver Downtown, Portland, Vancouver, Salmon Creek, Hazel Dell North, Lake Shore, Hazel Dell South, Mount Vista, Barberton, Jantzen Beach, Vancouver Lake, Felida, Delta Park, Clark County Events Center, Sauvie Island and Minnehaha. This includes the following highways in Washington... Interstate 5 between mile markers 1 and 11. Interstate 205 between mile markers 36 and 37. State Route 14 near mile marker 1. This includes the following highways in Oregon... Interstate 5 between mile markers 307 and 308. U.S. Highway 30 west of Portland between mile markers 9 and 12. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
